intro: Lastreopsis acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed lastreopsis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
